storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to receive real-time alerts when conflicts occur to promptly resolve scheduling issues

testCases.title: Validate real-time alert display on conflict detection
preconditions: Scheduler is logged into the scheduling system
Scheduler has appropriate permissions to create and modify schedules
Scheduling interface is loaded and functional
At least one existing schedule entry is present in the system

steps.action: Scheduler creates a new schedule entry that conflicts with an existing schedule (e.g., same resource, overlapping time)
steps.expectedResult: Alert is displayed immediately on the scheduling interface showing conflict notification

steps.action: Scheduler clicks on the alert to view details
steps.expectedResult: Detailed conflict information is shown including conflicting schedules, resources involved, time overlap, and affected parties

steps.action: Scheduler clicks the acknowledge button on the alert
steps.expectedResult: Alert is dismissed from the interface and no longer visible in the active alerts list

postconditions: Alert has been acknowledged and removed from active display
Conflicting schedule entry remains in the system
Alert acknowledgment is recorded in system logs

testCases.title: Verify email notification delivery for conflicts
preconditions: Scheduler is logged into the scheduling system
Scheduler has email notifications enabled in user preferences
Valid email address is configured in scheduler's profile
Email service is operational and configured correctly
Scheduler has access to their email inbox

steps.action: Verify that scheduler has email notifications enabled in system preferences
steps.expectedResult: Email notification preference is set to 'enabled' for conflict alerts

steps.action: Create a scheduling conflict by adding an overlapping schedule entry
steps.expectedResult: System detects the conflict and sends an email notification to the scheduler's registered email address

steps.action: Scheduler opens their email inbox and locates the conflict notification email
steps.expectedResult: Conflict notification email is received with subject line indicating scheduling conflict, email body contains detailed conflict information including resources, times, and affected schedules

steps.action: Scheduler clicks the link provided in the email to view the conflict
steps.expectedResult: Browser navigates to the scheduling interface with the specific conflict highlighted and conflict details displayed

postconditions: Email notification has been successfully delivered and opened
Scheduler is viewing the conflict in the scheduling interface
Conflict remains unresolved and visible in the system

testCases.title: Ensure alert delivery within 1 second
preconditions: Scheduler is logged into the scheduling system
System is operating under normal load conditions
Performance monitoring tools are available and configured
System logs are accessible for latency verification
Timer or stopwatch is available to measure alert delivery time

steps.action: Note the current time and trigger a scheduling conflict by creating an overlapping schedule entry
steps.expectedResult: Alert is displayed on the scheduling interface within 1 second of conflict creation, measured from submission to alert appearance

steps.action: Repeat the conflict creation process 10 times, monitoring and recording alert delivery times for each event
steps.expectedResult: All 10 alerts are delivered within 1 second of conflict detection, with consistent performance across all iterations

steps.action: Access system logs and review alert latency metrics for the test period
steps.expectedResult: System logs show all alert delivery times are within the 1-second SLA, with timestamps confirming conflict detection time and alert delivery time

postconditions: All test alerts have been delivered within performance SLA
Performance metrics are documented in system logs
Test conflicts can be cleaned up or remain for further testing

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to acknowledge conflict alerts to confirm I have seen and will address scheduling issues

testCases.title: Validate alert acknowledgment requirement before dismissal
preconditions: Scheduler is logged into the scheduling system
A conflict alert has been triggered and is displayed on the interface
Alert is in unacknowledged state
Scheduler has permissions to acknowledge alerts

steps.action: Scheduler views the conflict alert displayed on the scheduling interface
steps.expectedResult: Alert is displayed with clear acknowledgment button or checkbox option visible, alert shows unacknowledged status

steps.action: Scheduler attempts to dismiss or close the alert without clicking the acknowledgment button (e.g., clicking X or close button)
steps.expectedResult: System blocks the dismissal action and displays a prompt or message requiring acknowledgment before dismissal, alert remains visible on the interface

steps.action: Scheduler clicks the acknowledge button on the alert
steps.expectedResult: Alert status updates to 'acknowledged', acknowledgment confirmation is displayed, and alert can now be dismissed successfully

postconditions: Alert status is marked as acknowledged in the system
Alert can be dismissed by the scheduler
Acknowledgment is recorded with user identity and timestamp

testCases.title: Verify acknowledgment is logged correctly
preconditions: Scheduler is logged into the scheduling system with known user credentials
A conflict alert is displayed and available for acknowledgment
System logging is enabled and functional
Access to system logs and audit trail is available
Database or log query tools are accessible

steps.action: Note the current timestamp and scheduler's user ID, then click the acknowledge button on the conflict alert
steps.expectedResult: System displays acknowledgment confirmation and alert status changes to acknowledged

steps.action: Access the acknowledgment logs through the system admin panel or database query
steps.expectedResult: Acknowledgment log entry is present containing the correct user ID, alert ID, and timestamp within 1 second of the acknowledgment action

steps.action: Check the audit trail for acknowledgment events related to the specific alert
steps.expectedResult: Audit trail shows complete and accurate event record including user identity, alert identifier, acknowledgment timestamp, and action type as 'alert_acknowledged'

postconditions: Acknowledgment is permanently recorded in system logs
Audit trail contains complete acknowledgment event details
Log entries are available for compliance and reporting purposes

testCases.title: Ensure acknowledgment processing completes within 1 second
preconditions: Scheduler is logged into the scheduling system
A conflict alert is displayed and ready for acknowledgment
System is operating under normal load conditions
Performance monitoring tools are available
Timer or performance measurement tool is ready

steps.action: Note the current time and click the acknowledge button on the conflict alert
steps.expectedResult: Acknowledgment is processed and confirmed within 1 second, alert status updates to acknowledged, and UI reflects the change immediately

steps.action: Monitor and record system response times during the acknowledgment process using performance tools or browser developer tools
steps.expectedResult: Response time metrics show acknowledgment API call completes within 1 second, network latency and processing time are within acceptable ranges

steps.action: Review system logs and error logs for any errors or warnings during the acknowledgment process
steps.expectedResult: No errors or exceptions are logged, acknowledgment completes successfully with HTTP 200 status code, and transaction is committed to database

postconditions: Acknowledgment has been processed within performance SLA
No errors occurred during acknowledgment processing
Alert status is successfully updated to acknowledged
Performance metrics are documented for compliance verification

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to configure notification preferences for conflict alerts to receive alerts via my preferred channels

testCases.title: Validate notification preference configuration UI
preconditions: Scheduler user account is created and active
Scheduler is logged into the system
User has valid email address in profile
Notification settings page is accessible
At least email and in-app notification channels are available

steps.action: Navigate to user profile menu and click on 'Notification Settings' option
steps.expectedResult: Notification settings page loads successfully displaying all available notification channel options (email and in-app)

steps.action: Review the notification preference options displayed on the page
steps.expectedResult: UI displays checkboxes or toggle switches for email and in-app notification channels with clear labels and current selection status

steps.action: Select 'Email' notification channel by checking the checkbox
steps.expectedResult: Email checkbox is marked as selected and visual feedback confirms the selection

steps.action: Select 'In-app' notification channel by checking the checkbox
steps.expectedResult: In-app checkbox is marked as selected and visual feedback confirms the selection

steps.action: Click 'Save' or 'Update Preferences' button
steps.expectedResult: System displays success message confirming preferences have been saved, and selected channels remain checked

steps.action: Create a scheduling conflict by attempting to book overlapping appointments
steps.expectedResult: System detects the conflict and triggers a conflict alert

steps.action: Check email inbox for conflict alert notification
steps.expectedResult: Conflict alert email is received with details of the scheduling conflict

steps.action: Check in-app notifications panel or bell icon
steps.expectedResult: Conflict alert appears in the in-app notification center with conflict details

postconditions: Notification preferences are saved in the database
Selected channels (email and in-app) are active for future alerts
Conflict alert was successfully delivered via both selected channels
User remains on notification settings page or is redirected to dashboard

testCases.title: Verify immediate application of preference changes
preconditions: Scheduler user account is created and active
Scheduler is logged into the system
Initial notification preferences are already configured (e.g., email only)
User has access to notification settings
System has logging capability enabled for preference changes

steps.action: Navigate to notification settings page
steps.expectedResult: Notification settings page loads showing current preferences (email selected)

steps.action: Uncheck 'Email' notification channel
steps.expectedResult: Email checkbox is unchecked and visual feedback shows deselection

steps.action: Check 'In-app' notification channel
steps.expectedResult: In-app checkbox is checked and visual feedback shows selection

steps.action: Click 'Save' or 'Update Preferences' button
steps.expectedResult: System displays success message 'Preferences updated successfully' and timestamp of update is shown

steps.action: Note the current time and immediately create a scheduling conflict
steps.expectedResult: System detects the scheduling conflict and triggers a conflict alert

steps.action: Check email inbox for conflict alert
steps.expectedResult: No conflict alert email is received (email channel was disabled)

steps.action: Check in-app notifications panel
steps.expectedResult: Conflict alert appears in the in-app notification center according to new preferences

steps.action: Access system logs or admin panel to review preference change events
steps.expectedResult: System logs show preference update timestamp and immediate application with no delay between save and activation

steps.action: Verify log entries show alert delivery method matches updated preferences
steps.expectedResult: Logs confirm alert was sent only via in-app channel, matching the updated preferences

postconditions: Updated notification preferences are active in the system
Email notifications are disabled for the user
In-app notifications are enabled for the user
System logs reflect the preference change and immediate application
No delay observed between preference update and alert delivery

testCases.title: Ensure validation of user contact information
preconditions: Scheduler user account is created and active
Scheduler is logged into the system
Notification settings page is accessible
Email notification channel is available
User profile has existing valid email address

steps.action: Navigate to notification settings page
steps.expectedResult: Notification settings page loads successfully with current contact information displayed

steps.action: Click on 'Edit Contact Information' or email field to modify email address
steps.expectedResult: Email input field becomes editable and cursor is positioned in the field

steps.action: Enter invalid email address 'invalidemail@' in the email field
steps.expectedResult: Email field accepts the input temporarily

steps.action: Select 'Email' notification channel checkbox
steps.expectedResult: Email checkbox is marked as selected

steps.action: Click 'Save' or 'Update Preferences' button
steps.expectedResult: System displays validation error message 'Please enter a valid email address' in red text near the email field, and preferences are not saved

steps.action: Verify that the invalid email is highlighted or marked with error indicator
steps.expectedResult: Email field is highlighted with red border or error icon indicating validation failure

steps.action: Clear the email field and enter valid email address 'scheduler@example.com'
steps.expectedResult: Email field accepts the valid input and error indicators are removed

steps.action: Ensure 'Email' notification channel remains selected
steps.expectedResult: Email checkbox is still checked

steps.action: Click 'Save' or 'Update Preferences' button
steps.expectedResult: System displays success message 'Preferences saved successfully' and no validation errors appear

steps.action: Create a scheduling conflict to trigger an alert
steps.expectedResult: System detects the conflict and triggers a conflict alert

steps.action: Check the email inbox at 'scheduler@example.com'
steps.expectedResult: Conflict alert email is successfully delivered to the corrected email address with conflict details

postconditions: Valid email address is saved in user profile
Email notification channel is active with validated contact information
Notification preferences are successfully saved
Alert delivery is functional with corrected email address
System maintains data integrity by rejecting invalid contact information
